content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Coal Mining Station at (-15, -15)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (24.0, -15.0)
- Wooden chest at (23.5, -16.5) for coal storage

### Iron Ore Mining Station at (-14, 23)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (-14.0, 23.0)
- Wooden chest at (-14.5, 21.5) for iron ore storage

### Copper Ore Processing Line at (20, 20)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (20.0, 20.0) for copper ore extraction
- Wooden chest at (20.5, 21.5) for temporary copper ore storage
- Input inserter at (19.5, 21.5) moving ore from drill to chest
- Output inserter at (21.5, 21.5) moving ore from chest to belt
- Belt system running from (21.5, 17.5) to (21.5, 21.5)
- Furnace at (24.0, 20.0) for smelting copper ore
- Furnace input inserter at (22.5, 20.5) moving ore from belt to furnace
- Output chest at (24.5, 17.5) for copper plates
- Output inserter at (24.5, 18.5) moving plates from furnace to chest
- Additional belt system from (22.5, 21.5) to (26.5, 18.5)

### Unused Furnaces at (-11, 20)
Two stone furnaces at:
- (-11.0, 20.0)
- (-9.0, 20.0)

ERROR TIPS

### Entity Placement Conflicts
- Before placing inserters or other entities, check if the target position is already occupied by another entity
- When placing entities in a production line, ensure proper spacing between components to avoid overlap
- The error at step 39 occurred because an inserter already existed at the target position (24, 18.5)

### Resource Management
- Multiple mining drills are out of fuel (at -14.0, 23.0 and 24.0, -15.0)
- Maintain regular fuel checks and refueling routines for all burner entities
- Consider setting up automated fuel delivery systems for mining operations

### Production Line Design
- When designing production lines, plan the layout carefully to ensure all components have sufficient space
- Consider using a blueprint or planning phase to verify entity placement before actual construction
